items.title: Program Manager of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging
items.content:
Program Manager of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging at Articulate

Remote

ANYWHERE IN US

PEOPLE

FULL-TIME

The Program Manager will manage and execute diversity, inclusion, and belonging initiatives at Articulate. Reporting to the VP of People, the person in this role will champion and build upon our efforts to create and implement programs that promote a culture of diversity, inclusion, and belonging and grow our diverse employee population.

In addition to executing diversity, inclusion, and belonging goals and objectives, the Program Manager will review and monitor data to measure inclusion; design initiatives aimed at improving diversity and inclusion; partner with and support Employee Resource Groups; and develop learning opportunities in the form of brown bags, training, written materials, and more.

Your responsibilities:

  • Act as a subject matter expert to internal and external partners on diversity and inclusion trends, best practices, programs, and initiatives
  • Develop, implement, and facilitate training programs that foster a culture of equality and equity in the form of e-learning and facilitated learning sessions
  • Schedule and facilitate the “I’m Not Racist Am I?” course with new hires
  • Consult with key stakeholders on diversity, inclusion, and belonging
  • Administer our annual inclusion engagement survey, then analyze results and make recommendations on areas of improvement
  • Design and execute initiatives aimed at improving diversity, inclusion, and belonging
  • Manage the diversity, inclusion, and belonging committee
  • Partner with, grow, and support our Employee Resource Groups
  • Work closely with the People team to build underrepresented talent pipelines through online sourcing, events, partnerships and sponsorships, and sourcing campaigns
  • Execute programs that foster growth, development, and retention of diverse employees

Qualifications and skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required
  • 3+ years’ experience doing diversity and inclusion work with effective results
  • Ability to work effectively with multicultural/racial/ethnic/diverse populations
  • Knowledge of best practices in the areas of diversity, inclusion, and belonging
  • Ability to facilitate training around diversity, inclusion, and belonging concepts and practices
  • Ability to gain trust across a wide variety of audiences
  • Excellent program and project management skills, with the ability to think and execute programmatically
  • Ability to analyze data and translate it into actionable insights
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Extremely high EQ

About Articulate

Articulate is a highly successful, fully remote software company that’s changing the way the world learns. Our award-winning e-learning tools are used by 78,000+ organizations across the globe to create engaging online and mobile courses. Our customers include 93 of the Fortune 100 and 19 of the top 20 U.S. universities. And our online community of 605,000+ members is the largest, fastest-growing community in the industry.

We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. We’re all free to exercise our crafts the best way we know how to reach our goals as individuals and teams. Each and every one of us is focused on producing results that directly impact the company’s success. And we all strive to do what’s right by people, both internally and externally, instead of taking the shortest route to the highest profits.

We honor people’s humanity in all of our disparate experiences and social locations, accepting each person as an individual with a story worth listening to and honoring. We believe that honoring everyone’s humanity means being committed to equity and justice. We welcome different voices and viewpoints and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, age, sexual orientation, and military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an equal opportunity employer and invite applicants to voluntarily disclose their race and gender on our application form to help us create a diverse company. This voluntarily disclosed information will not be shared with any hiring manager and will be kept in confidence by the Articulate human resources department and executives who are not hiring for this position.

items.content:
Marketplace Enablement Manager

Description

Fanatical Labs operates two software marketplaces, SugarOutfitters (sugaroutfitters.com) and SuiteCRM Store (store.suitecrm.com). On our marketplaces we sell CRM software add-ons and integrations for SugarCRM and SuiteCRM. This software ranges from simple one-feature tools to complex two-way software integrations.

We are looking for a friendly, helpful person to assist customers, sellers, and affiliates on our marketplaces. Customers are SugarCRM or SuiteCRM users that need additional functionality. Sellers create, sell, and support the software add-ons and integrations on our stores. Affiliates leverage these add-ons and integrations for their potential or current CRM clients.

We are currently looking for someone based in the U.S. that has small business experience in a support and/or partner engagement role that leans towards the software app/integrations space. 

The right person for this role will be comfortable with a wide range of tasks such as copywriting, basic marketing campaigns, providing first tier support, and relationship management.

A Typical Day

  • Process any live chat conversations; typically connecting to right partner or billing help
  • Run through new emails, connecting folks with the right partner whenever possible
  • Identify any refund requests or other billing issues and address
  • Identify any new add-on reviews for possible promotion
  • Process new add-ons in various onboarding stages
  • Create email, blog, social media announcements for new add-ons
  • Explore new opportunities or initiatives for ongoing add-on promotions 

Immediate Responsibilities Include

  • Help customers by connecting them to the right resources or people
  • Help customers with billing issues
  • Help sellers with onboarding new products and providing ongoing support
  • Help affiliates by provisioning demo keys and recommending solutions
  • Ongoing documentation of internal processes for this role
  • Improve existing content and create new content for blogs, emails, and social media

Requirements

  • By nature, a friendly, helpful human being
  • Refined writing skills
  • Great communicator
  • Embraces a friendly tone in written communication
  • Being able to read and understand technical documentation
  • Understands the basics of how to use web-based applications
  • Genuinely cares about the success of others
  • 2-3 weeks of business travel each year
  • This is a full time position


Desired Background

  • Customer support experience
  • Partner Enablement experience
  • Copywriting experience


Benefits



Work wherever

We all work remote. Want to go work on the beach? It’s up to you.

40 hour work week

We all have our own lives. That’s why we work after all. We respect your time away and want you to be able to walk away from your work.

Vacations and paid holidays

Go on vacation. Take time away. As a guideline we offer 3 weeks of paid leave. Need a few more days? Not a problem. It’s just a number we pulled out of a hat. We will work with you to make sure there is functional coverage while you are away.

Competitive salary

We monitor industry salaries and make sure we’re paying in the top 25%, based on skills and experience, for every position. Salaries are standardized on the Minneapolis/St. Paul market.

Health, Dental and Vision insurance

We offer a multitude of options for Health, Dental, and HSA accounts for you and your family or domestic partner. We pitch in $325 a month to whichever plan you pick.

Paid parental leave

Family is very important to us. Whenever you welcome a new baby we encourage you to take up to 12 weeks leave as the primary caregiver and up to 6 weeks as a secondary caregiver at 100% salary. You can choose to take an additional 8 weeks of unpaid leave.

Retirement Planning

100% match 401k Retirement plan. We will match your contributions dollar-for-dollar up to 4% of your salary.

Hardware and software

Whatever hardware or software you need to do your job will always be covered by us.

Office stipend

We will work with you to cover any reasonable cost associated with a personal office outside of your home.

Remote Work Package

Internet is a requirement for work. To help with that cost we roll an additional $50 a month into your salary.

Charitable matching

We will match up to $500 a year to any 501c3 organization that you donate to. We love a good cause that excites you.

Fitness allowance

We will pay up to $50 a month for whatever it is that you do to stay in shape.

A little about us


A small group of driven, self-motivated, honest, fun-loving people who want to help businesses, both non-profit or for-profit, be more successful.

Fanatical Labs is a remote only company. We believe people are at their best when they can operate freely.

We have been profitably creating and selling software integrations since we originally formed in 2011 with no outside investment.

These are some of the values that we hold near and dear to us:

Freedom

We believe we are at our best when we can each operate freely.

Improvement

We value an ongoing pursuit of improvement; personally and professionally.

Always Do Good

“ADG” as we call it. We go the extra mile even if there is no expected return for doing so.

Relentless

We value determination. We never shy away from a challenge and relentlessly persevere towards overcoming roadblocks.

Positive Environment

We choose to be positive in all of our interactions.

Transparent

We strive to be as transparent as possible with employees, customers, and partners.



What it's like to work here



We are extremely small. Because of that you will have quite a bit of freedom and leeway to do things the way you best see fit. Sound both exciting and overwhelming?

That’s normal. That is why we value a relentless pursuit of improvement and knowledge. Especially since software is an ever changing world.

While we work mostly independently, we are always ready to jump in and help one another get over any seemingly impossible hurdles.


What the Future Holds


As we are a very small company, there are multiple avenues of career growth. We see paths for a director of partner enablement or even a more marketing-centric role. We acknowledge that there may even be other paths that are unknown at this time. In many ways, it really will be up to you and your strengths.


A little about you


You are a highly driven person. One others may consider an “over achiever”. You are inquisitive; always wanting to learn more. You are reliable, personable, and mostly cheerful; having a positive impact on others is important to you.

If this sounds like you then this company might be the right place for you.

items.content:
Our Story


 


Founded in 2016 by Allan Baudoin and Bo van Langeveld, Baudoin & Lange designs, manufactures and sells high-end shoes for men and women.  


 


Allan Baudoin, a computer scientist and Apple alumni turned self-trained bespoke shoe maker, designed and handcrafted the first Sagan in 2014 as his own atelier shoes - hundreds of prototypes and two years of development later, the Sagan was born - instantly conquering the connoisseurs regulars of "the Row" with their supreme comfort, fit for a modern lifestyle.


 


When he and Bo van Langeveld, an ex-racing driver turned financier who was tired of suffering in his obligatory formal office shoes, met - they together developed the idea of a modern shoe brand that would combine the best of both worlds: comfort and style.


 


Our first staple product, the Sagan, is a supremely comfortable and versatile category defining loafer, featured in major publications and sold in over a hundred countries.  


 


We have been experiencing rapid online and offline growth, particularly in the US and Asian markets, where our stockists and partners range from high-end tailoring shops to the most renowned luxury department stores.


 


To date, Baudoin & Lange benefited from compelling triple-digit organic growth; our customers are incredibly engaged with our brand and are our advocates, word-of-mouth has contributed significantly to discovery and we are one of the youngest companies to have firm partnerships with global luxury department stores (Harrods, Selfridges, Barney’s, Beams Japan etc) have been very successful.  Our social media engagement rates are high, and bloggers and influencers love our shoes!


 


The Opportunity


 


We are looking for retail ambassadors who can communicate passionately about the Baudoin and Lange brand and provide visitors of our first central physical UK location with an amazing try-on experience. This position will be based in our Burlington Arcade pop up, near Piccadilly station. Your primary work location will be on the sales floor of London’s Historical Landmark, this area is a major tourist destination and a vibrant, multicultural gathering place in Central London.


 


This is an opportunity for those who thrive in a fast-paced environment, see themselves as more than a Sales Associate/Retail ambassador but as a true personal ‘advisor’- someone who is seeking to grow their career in the luxury retail environment, has a strategic sales mindset, willingness to learn and a passion for forming meaningful relationships with a global clientele. As we value forward thinking individuals, we welcome someone who is eager to contribute their creativity and skill set to continue to the success and strong heritage of the brand.

In order to be successful in this role you must be someone who has experience working in a luxury or high end retail environment or has a strong history involving customer service, dealing with a diverse and elevated clientele. Someone who is motivated to continuously improve personal performance, works well in a team setting, possesses elevated interpersonal skills and the curiosity to discover and enhance the customer in-store experience.


 


This is an extraordinary opportunity to protect, enhance and strengthen our retail sales activity across current and future retail locations, and to take true ownership of our new store front.  In return, we offer a chance to work in a creative and fast-paced environment, directly with the founders, through which you’ll get exposure and insight into the luxury industry with a fresh perspective.


 


About You


 


As our Store Manager, you will be an ambassador of the Brand, ensuring that every Client is treated according to the Baudoin and Lange promise. You will strive to discover your Clients and their every need, and to guide them across the Brand.


 


Requirements


 



  • Promote and drive the company culture

  • Ensure store operations are functioning properly, request for maintenance if needed.

  • Execute and delegate operational tasks and productivity

  • Communicate with Retail Ambassadors specific business communications and new products

  • Ensure proper visual merchandising standards on the retail floor and windows

  • Ensure all current product is exposed on retail floor

  • Ensure customer satisfaction and resolve point-of-sale discrepancies

  • Monitor stock levels and ensure Retail Ambassadors are filling shelves

  • Assist in sales and cashiering

  • Manage day to day operations of the store

  • Work closely with Head of Sales to optimize in-store offering and stock management to optimize sales


 


What kind of person are we looking for? 



  • Prior retail experience desired, ideally in fashion or footwear

  • Positive attitude and enthusiasm

  • Engaging relationship building with customers with the goal of every customer leaving with a smile

  • Connection to Baudoin and Lange’s philosophy and products

  • Pride of ownership with store appearance, cleanliness and organization

  • Willingness to go above and beyond

  • Once trained, use the POS system accurately to process sales

  • Actively contribute towards meeting and exceeding the team's sales goals

  • Have a ‘can-do’ attitude, flexibility, creativity and very hands-on

  • Have excellent communication skills and established experience in presenting to senior leadership

  • Proper presentation and tone-of-voice that corresponds with our brand image


 


What We Can Do For You



  • Competitive compensation package

  • Team of positive, enthusiastic, and passionate people

  • Duration: Fixed term 3 month contract with option to convert to full-time and opportunity to grow within the company

  • Free pair of shoes!

Position Description

Bring us your experience, your head for strategy, your strength with relationships and your eye for opportunity. In return we offer an unmatched place to grow and develop your career among a richly diverse group of businesses driven by the power and stability of a leading health care organization. Come help us heal and strengthen the health care system as you do your life’s best work.(sm)

OptumRx is an innovative pharmacy benefit management organization managing the prescription drug benefits of commercial, Medicare and other governmental health plans, as well as those of employers and unions. Services offered by the company include pharmacy network contracting, rebate contracting and administration, mail order pharmacy facilities, specialty drugs and retail drug claims processing. OptumRx is part of Optum, a leading information and technology-enabled health services business dedicated to making the health system work better for everyone.

We’re looking for a skilled professional to join us in this highly visible role. You would be responsible for the interacting and providing legal guidance to the senior leadership of the Optum Workers’ Compensation & Auto No Fault division and performing legal tasks including the production of customer contracts, negotiating, documenting changes. The person in this position will also advise and consult with internal stake holders and external customers on issues relating to the pharmacy benefit management and ancillary services within workers compensation, medicare set aside and workers compensation managed care lines of business. . Function as part of a high performing, collegial team on high profile matters.

As a member of the legal team, close collaboration with colleagues is expected, as well as a willingness to adapt to the changing legal support requirements of our growing business.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

  • Advise workers’ compensation business leaders on client and contract related matters, including potential liability and exposure, and resolving disputes outside of litigation
  • Collaborate with other enterprise counsel on various matters relating to clients and the business generally
  • Operate in a strategic and pro-active manner to assist our internal business clients in managing their relationships with clients, and managing the legal and regulatory risk related to the provision of prescription drug benefits to client services
  • Support various internal clients with managing their relationships with clients and responding to client inquiries such as complaints, audit and WC-PBM regulatory matters.

  • Support the internal workers’ compensation governmental affairs team with assessing applicability of various regulatory and legislative initiatives, including licenses and MAC rules, to workers’ compensation pharmacy benefit management and other lines of business such as Medicare set-aside and third party billing.
  • Support the internal compliance team with analysis of regulatory initiatives and compliant implementations.
  • This is a mid-level attorney position within our organization

  • Juris Doctorate degree
  • 5+ years of experience advising companies in negotiation and drafting of complex professional services agreements in the healthcare industry or other highly regulated industries
  • Experience building and maintaining rapport with superiors, peers, subordinates, and external company contacts, with demonstrated ability to lead and contribute to team effort

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience working with the pharmacy and pharmacy benefits management industries
  • Understanding of the managed health care industry

items.content:
Are you passionate about big data & property investment?


If so, we're looking to hire a talented CTO/Head of Data to join our growing team.


Who We Are:


We’re Yuvoh. A London-based Proptech Start-up, established in 2017.


We help people looking to make smart property investments and turn them into profitable long term and short-term holiday rentals.


This means we help people find their ideal property investment, give them the right data and tools which allow them to make smart choices based on the metrics they care about and then get the right financing to manage the property and maximise cash flow. We can even help with furnishing the property at the end if required.


Essentially, using our smart data analytics platform and expert market knowledge, we make the end-to-end property investment process fast, simple and stress-free.


In the last 6 months we have started to commercialise our data services and have started to sell services into lenders.


What We’re Offering:


An exciting opportunity for a talented CTO/Head of Data join our busy team.


You’ll create and implement the technology strategy and 12-month roadmap, which underpins our smart data analytics platform (data as a service). This will include understanding Yuvoh’s existing technologies, as well as new technologies that can support and transform our clients ( property investors and lenders) to make smarter decisions using big data and analytics. You will be responsible for the security and integrity of our data services, and be responsible for ensuring we can add value to our customers. You’ll also manage our small tech team (in-house and remote workers).


This job is for you if you have:



  • A strong technology background, and enthusiasm to roll up your sleeves to make progress on the strategy

  • Experience of leading complex big data as a service projects, working in an agile way

  • Strong knowledge of data science, and front and back end development

  • Experience in a start-up / small business environment

  • Great leadership skills to manage, motivate and develop a tech team of 5+ people which comprises of data scientists and engineers. Experience managing a remote team / third parties is highly desirable

  • Commercial acumen to build practical solutions that deliver a great customer experience, working in a lean, cost-conscious way

  • Gravitas and the ability to present and pitch the product to stakeholders in a compelling way


Prior CTO experience is not essential, but ambition and drive to become a CTO in an exciting, fast-growing start-up is a must.


We may also consider people who require a visa, looking to relocate to London.


What you’ll get:



  • A competitive base salary. Plus, if you prove yourself to be a talented, loyal and committed member of the team, this will be recognised and rewarded through discretionary stock options and bonuses.[1][2] 

  • Interesting, challenging work and autonomy, so you feel excited to come into work each day

  • Work-life balance. Team members can work from home when needed

  • A fun working environment. We are part of a great co-working community with regular social events, food pop-ups and social drinks events and best of all, it's a dog-friendly office so there are plenty of pooches around!

  • A workspace that is convenient and productive, with super-fast internet, fully stocked coffee bar, private phone booths and more. Based in trendy Shoreditch, we are right in the heart of central London, surrounded by restaurants, bars, artisan boutiques, high street favourites, and street art. And Liverpool Street Station is just a short walk away 

  • The best tools for the job, to ensure you are set up for success


If you’re interested, please send us your CV and covering letter

Project Coordinator at Township

Remote
Township is… 

Township is looking to add an experienced, US-based Project Coordinator to our remote team! This will be our first hire for this type of role. 

Township is a fully remote, US-based digital product agency. We have a few strongly held convictions:

We take care of each other

We believe strongly that companies should take care of their employees, and that employees should take care of each other. We provide weekly mentorship to help guide you down a career framework you’ll help us craft, a transparent and competitive compensation package, and generous benefits.

Do great work, and then do something else

We ask a lot of our team, but we also know that your job is only part of your life. We’ll keep you busy during ‘working hours’ but leave you plenty of time to pursue the things that are important to you outside of your job. We are committed to a 40 hour work week.

Great products are crafted by integrated teams

We believe that great products are created through the close collaboration of design and engineering. Our engineering team plays a big part in our design process, and our design team collaborates closely with the engineering team at all stages of the development process. 

We are looking for a Project Coordinator to join our nimble team of collaborative, driven engineers and designers at Township to help us create beautiful digital products and marketing materials.

Township’s Project Coordinator:
  • Makes it possible for the quality of work from the entire team to be elevated by removing overhead from our projects and loosening lynchpins.
  • Supports the functional lead of each project.
  • Serves as an internal resource to the team for moving projects forward on time and with strategic prioritization.
  • Writes thoughtful, thorough issues for both engineering and design projects.
  • Performs ongoing QA and communicates findings to team with efficiency and appropriate urgency.
  • Manages competing timelines across all projects and informs team of priorities and priority changes on a regular basis.
  • Provides team with a well-planned roadmap each week based on commitments and issues at hand.
  • Assists sales team with time estimation for proposals.
  • Is proactive in communicating to the sales team about when the team is available to take on new projects.
  • Assists functional leads and project managers with facilitating positive client interaction.
  • Has familiarity with technical jargon and basic application architecture ideas, though engineering experience is not required.
  • Advocates for time spent on internal products.
  • Is passionate about personal growth as well as helping improve the quality of work across the team.
  • Cultivates an environment of healthy communication, support, and collaboration.

If you check most or all of these boxes we would love to consider you for this position. Most qualified applicants will have 1 to 3 years of professional digital project coordination experience and have worked successfully on a remote team before.

Salary and Benefits

The starting salary for this position will be between $58,000 and $71,000 annually.

As for benefits, we offer many!

  • The cost of your health insurance is 100% covered by Township. You may also add your family to your plan, and we’ll cover 50% of their cost too.
  • The cost of vision and dental insurance is 100% covered by Township for both you and your family.
  • We are proud to offer twelve weeks of paid parental leave any time you add a new member to your family.
  • We will give you a company card that is loaded with $300 every month to cover work-related expenses, such as a coworking space membership, home internet, coffee, and so on.

items.content:
**MISSION AND TEAM**
We're re-building work and re-telling its story.


We’re building technology that ensures businesses can deliver software and data projects faster and to a higher standard than ever before. Our platform allows us to accurately scope the resource requirements for any technical project and assign an on-demand Elastic Team to deliver it.


Our Elastic Teams are a collection of engineers and data scientists selected from the top 1% of freelancers around the globe and managed through the Distributed platform.


You'll be teaming up with a group of scientists, engineers, product managers, and salespeople from the UK’s leading tech companies including Facebook, Uber and Babylon Health, who are challenging every assumption about how businesses deliver digital work.


We have recently secured £3m in seed funding from a top tier venture capital firm and are preparing for exceptional growth in 2020.


Want to know more? read: https://distributed.co/about-distributed


 


**VP PROJECT DELIVERY**
This is a leadership role where you will be driving the engine room of Distributed, ensuring that our Project Managers and Elastic Team deliver projects above and beyond our customers expectations.


 


**RESPONSIBILITIES**
• Ensuring every delivery through the Distributed platform is on time and accurately scoped by managing a team of project managers who work hand in hand with our global elastic team.
• Successfully scaling the Project Management team by sourcing, attracting and retaining top tier talent.
• Develop the Project Management team’s proficiency through effective coaching and leadership.
• Working closely with Customer Success to efficiently solve any customer problems.
• Working closely with Technical Heads to devise technical solutions to ensure the success of a delivery.
• Create and improve internal processes for scalability, repeatability and ensure that processes are being followed.


 


**WHO ARE YOU?**
You are here to own project delivery on behalf of Distributed by leading a team of top tier project managers and working in collaboration with our elastic team and internal functions.


You:
• are quick to understand and suggest solutions to highly technical problems.
• understand the vast variety of problems that technical projects face.
• can successfully build and lead a growing team of top tier project managers.
• enjoy working as part of a team and in a collaborative organisation.
• communicate clearly, concisely and often to internal and external stakeholders.
• have high EQ to help successfully advise on managing customers.


 


**PREFERRED EXPERIENCE**
• Extensive enterprise project management experience.
• Extensive product experience.
• Have successfully worked with remote teams.


 


**WHY YOU'LL LOVE WORKING AT DISTRIBUTED**
We are a high performing team of around 20 people based near Shoreditch. We celebrate our diverse group of talented employees and we pride ourselves on our transparent, collaborative, friendly and respectful culture.


We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, stock options, pension plans and private healthcare. We host regular company socials, weekly catered lunches and the office is full of snacks, coffee and beer on tap.


We value learning and will help you with your personal development in every way we can. The team regularly exchange books, podcasts, recommended readings and we actively support further education. Our mission is to help you succeed and flourish within the company and your career.

  • Monitoring and tracking project progress and deliverables using appropriate tools

  • Experience implementing stakeholder engagement/communications plan
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, the ability to build good relationships with the project teams and client is essential
  • Attention to detail

Benefits

100% Remote

items.content:
Digital Project Manager at Modern Tribe

Remote | Freelance | International
The Opportunity

We’re looking for a talented and experienced digital project manager in North America. We’re a WordPress agency so hopefully you have run some projects with the platform.

If you are drawn to order like a moth to a flame, then drop us a line. If you like maintaining lists and seeing team members make progress because you set them up to succeed, then you are perfect for this gig.

If you are skilled in agile, waterfall and whatever-suits-the-project techniques, then we should talk.

To be transparent, this is NOT a Digital Producer role. We have Strategists that you will be working with as well as UX team members. This gig is about organization and management more than it is about creative input.

Inclusion Statement

Modern Tribe is committed to a culture that embraces diversity and inclusion. We foster an environment of collaboration, open engagement, fairness and respect regardless of differences in age, race, disability, national origin, gender identity, religion, sexual orientation or veteran status. As a hybrid workspace ranging from distributed contractors to traditional employees, we value the unique perspectives and experiences of our global team.

We come from all walks of life. We are small business owners. We are tattoo aficionados and 80’s movie buffs and ex-pats. We are homeschool teachers. We are single parents. We are musicians, college drop-outs, and entrepreneurs. We are travelers, feminists, runners, volunteers, and makers. We are a Modern Tribe.

Everyday we strive to fulfill our motto: live well and do good work. We hope you will consider joining us.

Responsibilities

Your primary responsibility is to shepherd the project to success. We pride ourselves on our projects arriving on time, on scope, on budget with a happy team and customer. You will create confidence through organization and oversee communication. To do this, you will need to:

  • Manage scope, timeline and budget execution
  • Manage expectations for everyone on a project including the team, the account managers, and the customer
  • Run scrums and other status meetings
  • Review team hours
  • Write SOWs
  • Review budget
  • Set up and maintain tickets in the management system
  • Manage collection of assets and information from the customer
  • Perform meeting prep, prepare agendas, and handle all follow up
  • Produce weekly and monthly summary reports
Personal Competencies
  • Strong communication and/or experience working as part of a remote team
  • Self-motivated, detail-oriented, strong organizational skills, with a methodical approach to all tasks
  • Ability to prioritize workloads and meet deadlines
  • Ability to work independently with minimal oversight
  • Fluent English speaker
Required Knowledge & Experience
  • At least 5 years of experience working as a PM, ideally on a distributed web design / dev team
  • Experience with agile and waterfall management styles
  • Experience producing large CMS powered websites
  • A whiz when it comes to online collaboration tools. You feel at home when we talk about Slack, Google Hangout, Google Docs, Dropbox or any number of online PM tools.
  • Experience managing projects with budgets of at least $100k ($250k preferred)
Additional Experience (Bonus Points)
  • Experience with WordPress
  • Technical experience as a frontend or backend developer
  • Experience with enterprise level web development projects
  • Design experience
Location

Work from anywhere in North, Central or South America. If your timezone is outside of US business hours but you work at least 4+ hours of overlap each day, let’s chat. You must be fluent in English. You just need a computer and a strong wifi signal to support daily video chats with the Tribe.

Compensation

This is a freelance, contract gig (20 hours per week at a rate of $50-$60 USD).

Perks

We believe in learning from each other and fostering personal growth. You can expect to learn a lot while working with us and we have a benefits package for full time employees.

(Also, if you work enough with us, we’ll bring you on the team trip.

Who We Are

Modern Tribe, Inc. is a rapidly growing software & design company. We develop custom solutions for some of the world’s largest companies, government institutions and smaller growing organizations. We pride ourselves on our ability to bridge people and technology and to bring the passion and dedication of an entrepreneur to every project. Our team is composed of talented employees and freelancers around North & South America (and a smattering across the globe).

Who You Are

We love working with each other because we have built a culture that suits us well. We work primarily with freelancers and coordinate their talents for large projects. To be on our team, you must be:

  • HAPPY – Where there is a will, there is a way. Having a positive disposition allows us to achieve great things and to support each other.
  • HELPFUL – Always looking for ways that you can help others.
  • CURIOUS – It is essential that you have a passion for learning. Technology changes daily, and life has a way of constantly raising the bar.
  • ACCOUNTABLE – Our clients expect us to get the right thing done on budget and on time. Communicating expectations and meeting them is the cornerstone of success.
  • A Freelancer – This means that if you live within the USA, you will also maintain your own personal client list and that Modern Tribe will only comprise a portion of your total income. Regardless of where you live, you need to be already freelancing.
Apply for job

items.title: NHBC Inspection Manager (Scotland – Central Belt) - NHBC - Central Belt
items.content:
This is a fantastic opportunity to join the Inspection Management team. Our Inspection teams play a critical role in our success carrying out over one million inspections each year, working with builders and developers to provide the hundreds of thousands of high quality homes that the country needs.

This role is home based and due to the nature of the role, a full UK driving licence is essential.

The Job

You will be required to manage an efficient and effective inspection service. This will involve the deployment, management and support of Building Inspectors together with the promotion of the objectives of the Inspection Service - to provide excellent risk management, advance good customer relations and assist in developing NHBC’s business.

  • Managing a team of Building Inspectors
  • Monitor performance of inspectors, identifying outcomes and taking appropriate action
  • Carrying out performance and development reviews, agreeing objectives, identifying training and development needs, identifying links to personal and team development plans
  • Take responsibility as the primary contact for key NHBC Registered Builders which will involve effective customer relationship management.
  • Contributing to and support of the Operations Business Plan
  • Prepare and monitor the team Budget and deliver service within agreed limits
  • Assessing sites for NHBC “Pride in the Job” quality campaign

Essential Skills, Experience and Qualifications

  • Qualified to a minimum of HNC, HND, NVQ6 level in a construction related discipline
  • Management experience within the construction / house building industry
  • Experience of working in a change environment
  • In depth knowledge of NHBC Technical Standards and Building Regulations
  • Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines
  • Proactive, motivated and driven, with the ability to achieve results through the efforts of others
  • Excellent communicator with appropriate interpersonal skills, planning and organisational skills

Desirable Skills: Degree in a construction related discipline, Management qualifications, Full corporate membership of a relevant professional institution such as RICS, CABE, CIOB, ICE, IStructE or similar


The Benefits

- £46,000 - £54,000 (depending on experience and including remote worker allowance)

  • Up to 10% performance related bonus
  • Company car
  • 26 days pa annual leave entitlement with option to buy an additional week’s annual leave
  • Pension scheme (up to 10.5% of salary employer contribution)
  • Life assurance of 4 x salary
  • Subsidised private medical insurance
  • Cycle purchase scheme
  • High street discounts and preferential gym rates
  • Employee assistance programme

Relocation assistance may be available for the right candidate

Why NHBC?

Our purpose is to work with the house building industry to raise the standards of new homes and provide protection for homeowners. Homes are at the heart of all our lives and our colleagues are proud to be making a difference to improving the quality standards of new-build homes in the UK. Being an independent, non-profit distributing company with no shareholders means we can focus solely on our mission.

Always happy to talk flexible working

We encourage employees to work flexibly in different ways including home working, field working and both formal and informal flexible working arrangements. We don’t promise we can offer you what you want, but we are always willing and happy to talk flexible working options. This can be discussed further during the interview process.

Diversity and Inclusion

NHBC is committed to equal opportunities for all. We are a signatory to the Armed Forces Covenant and the Women in Finance Charter. Our inclusive culture helps us to maintain competitive advantage as we aim to attract people from diverse backgrounds to complement our team. Underlying our overall commitment to equality is the fundamental belief in the right of all employees and customers to be treated with dignity and respect and to be guaranteed freedom from discrimination.

Our Values

Excellent – Proud and professional in all that we do
Connected – Collaborating, sharing and achieving success as a team
Human – Challenging, supporting and respecting each other
Progressive – Inspired by possibilities, learning and adapting together

Central Belt
Permanent
£46,000 - £54,000 a year

items.content:
Director, Ecosystem – Partnership Management at Manifold

Remote | International

San Francisco, CA

Discover

The Opportunity

Can work Remote

Sales and Business Development

Management

Full-time – Permanent

At Manifold, we are building a marketplace of cloud-based developer tools and infrastructure services. We are looking for a strong sales / business development / account management professional to help us add more services to the marketplace, grow partnership revenue and help our partners succeed.

We currently have 40+ provider services in our marketplace but we’re just getting started. We believe there are thousands of potential partners out there including “tier one” services like Stripe, Twilio, MongoDB, and Fastly all the way down to nascent one-developer services. Your job is to pioneer successful tactics to pursue, secure and manage these partners.

Although we have been doing this for a while, this is a new, dedicated role and a greenfield opportunity: you will define, create, manage and execute the Partnership Management function.

Your compensation will include both a base salary and variable, target-based component.

What you’ll do

Responsibilities:

  • Add new Service Provider partners to the Manifold Marketplace
  • Assist Exec Team with new Platform Distribution partner opportunities for our Marketplace-as-a-Service
  • Manage the partner pipeline and business development process
  • Manage existing partner accounts with the goal of growing marketplace revenue for each partner
  • Work with Manifold’s Growth team on partner-targeted marketing content and programs
  • Act as the primary advocate for our partners’ interests within Manifold

What you’ll need

Qualifications:

  • Strong knowledge of the developer tools/cloud infrastructure space and competitive landscape.
  • A strong network of contacts in the developer tools/cloud infrastructure space.
  • Motivated by a quota-carrying sales role.
  • Pioneer. This is a new role for us. You’re comfortable refining the role and related programs as we go.
  • Strong presentation & pitch skills.
  • Strong relationship skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience working remotely/async in a global, distributed team.

We’re looking for

Core Skills:

Account Management Business Development Partner Management PartnershipsSales Sales Management

A little bit about us

Manifold

We’re a venture-backed company that is distributed around North America. Our home base is Halifax, Nova Scotia. We have a shared passion for making developers’ lives easier. Our backgrounds reflect that, having worked at npm, Red Hat, Heroku, LinkedIn, Canonical, and more.

We offer:

  • flexible working hours
  • 15 days of vacation your first year that you will be encouraged to use

Director, IT Operations and Infrastructure at Elastic.co

Remote

Location: Distributed, US

Elastic is a search company with a simple goal: to solve the world’s data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the creators of the Elastic Stack, we help thousands of organizations including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, Verizon, and many more use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what’s possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. We have a distributed team of Elasticians across 30+ countries (and counting), and our diverse open source community spans over 100 countries. Learn more at elastic.co

To support our continued growth we’re looking for a Director to lead our global IT Operations and Infrastructure team. This is a distributed role which can be located anywhere in the USA.

What You Will Be Doing:

This Director will craft the strategy, planning, design, delivery and operational management of all aspects of IT Operations and Infrastructure. Reporting to the Global VP of IT, you will build upon your leadership, knowledge and experience to deliver high-quality execution, customer-focused delivery, and operational excellence necessary to sustain this dynamic, growing business.

Specifically, you will:

  • Create strategic direction and oversight for the design, development, operation and support of processes and systems that fulfill the needs of the business in alignment with our distributed by design model
  • Implement policies, processes, procedures, automation and controls to consistently deliver high-quality service in a cost-effective manner
  • Build and develop a global, flexible, proactive, high-impact team
  • Plan and prioritize initiatives and drive the evaluation, deployment, and management of forward-looking infrastructure solutions to deliver automated, scalable, and reliable outcomes
  • Design and implement necessary security, SOC, SOX and IT policies and controls
  • Define and direct global help desk processes, systems, operations, and delivery using metrics, actionable trending, and critical metrics
  • Develop and maintain budgets that align with plans and service levels, improving value over cost ratio

What You Bring Along:

  • You have 10+ years of IT Ops and Infrastructure experience with 5+ years running global, cloud-first Ops/Infrastructure. On-premise managers need not apply.
  • You have both implemented and maintained a cloud-first application and infrastructure environment ideally at a larger scale organization than Elastic is today (~1600 employees).

In addition, you have/are:

  • Confirmed operational experience effectively evaluating, crafting, implementing and running 24×7 services (e.g. audio/web/video-conferencing, VOIP, network, server, helpdesk, laptop management) and associated vendors for a global IT infrastructure
  • Strong knowledge of architecture, design, implementation, and operations using cloud first solutions (e.g. OKTA, GitHub, Zoom, GSuite, Slack, JAMF)
  • Strong passion for user experience and delivering beyond the status quo
  • Experience developing talent and leading global and remote teams
  • Critical and structured thinking as well as executive-level influence to formulate and obtain broad support for proposed IT strategies and plans
  • Knowledge of security frameworks, technical designs and operational controls is desired
  • Experience with ITIL services and infrastructure processes and integrating them into an effective global operation
  • Highly collaborative and accountable

Additional Information:

We provide:

  • Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary.
  • Equity
  • Global minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave (moms & dads).
  • Generous vacation time and one week of volunteer time off.
  • An environment in which you can balance satisfying work with a great life.
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.
  • Distributed-first company with Elasticians in over 30 countries, spread across 18 time zones, and speaking over 30 languages.

Why work at WAX?

Simple. Instant. Secure. Global.

WAX is the safest and most convenient way to create, buy, sell, and trade virtual items – to anyone, anywhere in the world.

Hundreds of millions of people around the globe already trade digital items. But the problems that plague the item trading community have stunted its growth far beneath its full potential. That’s because the world of digital ownership today is defined by its restrictions. WAX is building a future to where it will be redefined by its freedom.

WAX is creating a full suite of blockchain-based tools that allows anyone to trade digital or even physical items instantly and securely, to anyone, anywhere.

Participants of the Worldwide Asset eXchange gain access to a global community of collectors and traders, buyers and sellers, creators and gamers, merchants and game developers.

We’re building the tools to create the future of digital ownership and trading through e-commerce blockchain, the first of its kind.

Summary

Our team is growing, and we’re looking to add a Director of User Experience & Design to help drive our product roadmap and manage the development of our core virtual goods business.

You will have the opportunity to be a part of an exceptional team of distributed engineers, designers, and product managers that are responsible for building and creating new solutions around the WAX platform, which allows millions of traders to create their own virtual stores on one decentralized platform, providing instant payments, security, and trusted service that will bring millions of new participants into a growing ecosystem.

As the Director of User Experience & Design, you will be a key member in leading the design through our rapidly evolving, complex demands, including product ideation around our marketplace and e-commerce experiences.

This role reports directly to the CEO.

Responsibilities

  • Define the overall UX/UI strategy and vision for our digital experience across all channels, aligned with our broader business strategy

items.content:
Vice President, Digital Sales at SAP

Remote

Location: Newtown Square, PA, US

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

ROLE DESCRIPTION:

The purpose of this position is to support all SAP P&T digital sales motions through the required end to end sales cycle processes. Our goal is flawless deal composition according to the SAP policies and processes, thus enabling extended market coverage and growth of the P&T business in the Americas region).

The Digital Sales leader will:

  • Be the expert on commercial frameworks and deal structures available for Services, Cloud and On-Premise Solutions.
  • Bring simplicity and promptly actioning by guiding on the commercial process through the multiple internal SAP process.
  • Be the trusted advisor of the Commercial teams on P&T topics when discussing the best deal composition and routing deal inquiries with legal and commercial finance, and other stake holder areas.

The Digital Sales team will serve the extended teams such as GCO Sales Industry Account Executives & Services GCO Sales teams. And will be the point of support to route deals execution and drive, either Big or Small deals from SCP, Key, NN or GB customer segments. While the customer facing, pipeline management and commercial aspects of the deal negotiation still relies on the corresponding sales team owner.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Support the direct and indirect sales motions of the P&T LoB.
  • Assist in planning deal composition for Complex Big deals
  • Advise on the appropriate Direct or Indirect deal structure of the deals and required internal process for deal approval.
  • Validate the availability and readiness from the sales team and commercial characteristics, prior to proceed with circulation of the internal processes.
  • Follow up on the internal process and progression through other SAP Deal Desk structures such as: Consulting Services Shared Desk, CST deals desk, Cloud deal desk, Maintenance GTM team, etc.
  • Act as a liaison with controlling, Commercial finance, O2I/Shares Services teams and Delivery Operations teams to assure alignment and minimize deal impact risk and surprise scenarios.

WORK EXPERIENCE:

  • Minimum 10+ years’ experience in sales, digital sales and sales leadership.
  • Preferably Sales Enabling & Support experience, working with sales executives across multiple countries and diverse type of solutions.
  • Experience on deal financials analysis and controlling knowledge is desirable.
  • Business level English mandatory.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). You will be a strategic thinker and have the ability to work collaboratively with multiple internal teams to ensure we are always delivering maximum value and impact for our clients. You'll also have a proven track record in upselling, confident negotiator and great at building and maintaining relationships.  

The ideal candidate would have previous experience as a sales engineer in a hi-tech environment and experience with managing a team.

Radix is building the foundation of tomorrow’s digital economy. 

Radix is a public decentralized ledger, like Ethereum or Bitcoin, but built without Blockchain. It will run on almost any device, have it's own low volatility token, and it is scalable enough for the entire world to use simultaneously.

Information Security Director at Sonatype

Remote

REMOTE

PRODUCT ENGINEERING – MANAGEMENT

FULL-TIME

The Information Security Director will be responsible for helping protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability (Security) of Sonatype’s information assets and IT resources, as well as the adherence to laws and contractual obligations regarding information processing critical to its mission. This position plays a material role in protecting these assets from events that may have a significant negative impact to the company and its customers. The Security Director will lead efforts to improve security awareness, manage security initiatives, develop and maintain security policies, and develop process orchestration and automation.

We’re looking for someone who is:

  • A subject matter expert in Information Security; deep technical understanding of security vulnerabilities and risks, as well as countermeasures and compensating controls.
  • Self-motivated problem solver with a desire to identify issues and formulate solutions that reduce risk and align with organizational strategies.
  • A great communicator, capable of speaking with executives, business, and technical audiences effectively.
  • An effective collaborator, able to partner with and work cross-functionally.
  • Capable of influencing prioritization and action on security-related objectives.
  • Capable of recruiting, building, and managing a team.

As an Information Security Director you will:

  • Build the vision, priorities, and information security requirements and plans.
  • Assess, revise, and/or develop standards, policies, and methodologies that support efficient security operations in an Agile, DevSecOps environment.
  • Develop and maintain Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery plans and coordinate periodic testing of those plans.
  • Manage information security initiatives including security assessments, improvements, incident response, and vendor or service provider relationships.
  • Collaborate with Business Partners and work cross-functionally with departmental team members to prioritize objectives and implement solutions.
  • Support customer and audit requests, as needed.
  • Create, maintain and report metrics on all security domains. Perform root cause analysis, recommend, and implement continuous improvement process opportunities based on the results of such metrics.
  • Create appropriate alerts, reports and dashboards to protect corporate and production systems.
  • Lead and manage the information security function (design the function; recruit, onboard, mentor, and manage members).

Requirements:

  • Minimum 10 years of related work experience.
  • Must have a Bachelor degree in Computer Science or a related field.
  • Security-focused certifications preferred (CISSP, Cyber Security Analyst or similar certificate).
  • Experience with cyber intelligence gathering, processing, and indicators of compromise (IOC) development.
  • Proficient in risk assessment and analysis methodologies, IT-related laws and compliance mandates, security frameworks and methodologies, incident management, and project management principles.
  • Proficient in developing use cases, evaluating alternative solutions, cost justification, recommended solutions, and comprehensive deployment plans.
  • Strong analytical, problem solving and conceptual skills to identify and deliver high performing solutions.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to express complex technical concepts in understandable business terms.
  • Experience attaining ISO 27001 1/2 certification or similar standard, preferably with Cloud-based applications (AWS), highly desirable.

We are 300 employees from diverse backgrounds, that hail from 50 countries, and speak 15 languages. But, we all share one thing in common: we’re passionate about accelerating software innovation. Our vision is to put Nexus products at the center of every open source decision made by modern engineering organizations. We’re one of the fastest growing tech companies in America and have been named both a Deloitte Fast 500 and Inc. 5000 company three years in a row. We’re backed by world class investors including TPG, Goldman Sachs, Accel Partners, and HWVP.

This is a unique opportunity with a company that lives and breathes for the success of salespeople. You should be a highly ambitious, results-driven and self-motivated individual that strives for excellence.

About The Role

You will be responsible for the success of our Sales Team and lead the company in providing our customers with exceptional actionable sales advice they won’t find anywhere else.

Your responsibilities will include managing our entire inbound sales funnel (14-day free Trial to close) and driving 2x growth in new MRR in the first year (we’ll talk specifics). On-boarding, training, and managing a team of Account Executives (2-3 in 2019) will also be in your wheelhouse.

You will collaborate with the Director of Marketing to increase conversion at the top of the funnel.

Requirements

  • More than 3 years of management experience of 10 people or larger in a remote environment
  • Based in North America (preference for EDT or CDT)
  • Experience selling SaaS to small businesses
  • EXPERT command of the English language (written and verbal)

Main KPIs

  • New Trial to Customer conversion rate
  • New customer growth
  • Total contract value (TCV) growth

Why Close?

At Close, everyone has a voice. We encourage transparency and practicing a mature approach to the work-place. In general, we don’t have strict policies, we have guidelines. Work/Life harmony is an important part of our organization – we believe you bring your best to work when you practice self-care (whatever that looks like for you).

We come from 12 countries and 14 states; a collection of talented humans rich in diverse backgrounds, lifestyles, and cultures. Twice a year we meet up somewhere around the world to spend time with one another. We see these retreats as an opportunity to strengthen the social fiber of our community.

This team is growing in more ways than one – we’ve recently launched 8 babies (and counting!). Unanimously, our favorite and most impactful value is “Build a house you want to live in.” We strive to make decisions that are authentic for our organization. At Close, we have a high care factor for one another, in making an awesome product and championing the success of our customers.

  • 100% Remote (we believe in trust and autonomy)
  • 2 x annual team retreats (Lisbon Retreat Video)
  • Competitive salary
  • Medical, dental with HSA option – 99% premiums paid (US residents)
  • 5 weeks PTO + 6 gov’t holidays + Dec 24 – Jan 1 company-wide holiday
  • Paid parental leave (10 wks primary caregiver / 4 wks secondary caregiver)
  • 401k matching at 4% (US residents)
  • Paid 1 month sabbatical after 5 years

items.content:
Head of Customer Service


Join us and take ownership of building a customer service function that allows us to scale our products and services while maintaining current standards of excellence and customer satisfaction.


About Koru Kids:


Koru Kids is building the world’s best childcare service, starting in London. Our mission is to profoundly impact the wellbeing of over a million families by 2024. We’re making it easier and more affordable for families to access high quality childcare. We’re growing like crazy, are backed by fantastic investors, including top venture capitalists and business angels, and have won a bunch of awards.


About the role:


We’re looking for someone bright and ambitious to build out an industry-leading customer service function. You’ll design customer support processes, tools and systems, grow the team, and lead the definition of a customer service function that supports us scaling rapidly. Customer service is at the heart of everything we do at Koru Kids and we are looking for someone who is truly customer obsessed who will represent the needs of both our families and nannies, keen to establish customer service as the heart and soul of the business.


About the team:


We have an informal, hard-working and kind team culture. We’re all passionate about our mission and are determined to create a truly fantastic childcare service to help working parents. Our culture is friendly and fast paced – we are constantly challenging, testing and adapting the way we do things. We’re also really committed to working with integrity, doing the right thing and building a company we are truly proud of. We’re growing super fast but we also want to make sure that we are building a company on really solid foundations.


What you will do: 



  • Set the long term direction of customer service including factoring the impact and demand of seasonality into capacity planning and building scalable processes.

  • Taking input from the customer service lead, you will galvanise other teams across the company such as product, engineering and operations to drive continuous improvement in our customer service, escalating bugs and issues as appropriate.

  • Collating qualitative and quantitative data from the customer service lead and UX lead, you will be a leading voice for the customer internally.

  • To accommodate our continual customer acquisition, you will introduce new and innovative ways to monitor customer contact and continue to deliver a first-class service e.g. a ticketing system, centralising all communications, optimising the use of various support channels etc.

  • Prioritise and recommend tool and service developments that help reduce the need for customers to contact us, make interactions smoother, and improve the overall customer experience. This will be in collaboration with the customer service lead and eventually a dedicated product manager.

  • Map out the customer journeys for both happy and unhappy customers and devise exciting new plans to delight and retain customers for current and new services.

  • Work with the Head of People to formalise onboarding, induction and training plans to be delivered in collaboration with the customer service lead.


Does this describe your background and approach? 



  • Experience managing empathetic customer service teams or growing out a customer service function within high growth environments.

  • A builder who enjoys the challenge of creating processes and plans from scratch, getting buy-in from the team(s) and then driving them through to completion.

  • The voice of customer service to the wider business, you will be comfortable giving presentations internally and advocating our customer service externally.

  • Someone constantly looking for ways to problem-solve, improve and challenge the status-quo.

  • A manager who is thrilled by improving team performance.

  • Awareness of the pounds and pennies with an appetite for lean efficiency.

  • Articulate communication representative of our brand and tone.

  • Comfortable under pressure, able to show good judgement when handling challenging situations, and not flustered by ambiguity.

  • Comfortable working with and analysing data.

  • Any prior experience coordinating and cooperating with product and engineering teams will be beneficial.


 


Is this how you behave?



  • Confident in robust debate, understanding how to pick your battles and knowing when it’s appropriate to stand your ground.

  • A tendency towards celebrating excellence.

  • Focussed and fast-paced, with acute time management and prioritisation.

  • With emotional intelligence. Choosing childcare is an emotional decision, and you’ll need to know when to listen as well as how to talk.

  • Comfortable with a degree of chaos.  Understanding that startups are unpredictable environments, you roll with it.

  • You’re nice. You get that no player is bigger than the team. You fit right into our culture of supporting and helping each other, whilst improving childcare in London and beyond.


 


A little more about us


As well as salary, all permanent employees are invited to become equity owners in the business, meaning you can truly share in our success.  We are huge fans of flexibility, remote working and you having an amazing work-life balance.


We work from a beautiful WeWork near Old St in central London.  Our offices are step-free, and have non-gendered bathrooms. As well as lots of free events including yoga, HIIT, and meditation, the office has showers and bike storage, free snacks and drinks.


If you’re interested, send us your CV.  Alternatively send us something else that demonstrates your literary prowess, technical capability, creativity or belief in our cause. Impress us; stand out.

items.content:
General Manager

Tortuga is seeking a General Manager (GM) to help us make travel easier and more enjoyable.

As GM, you will be the first non-founder people manager at the company. This is a pivotal hire for us. Today, we are a flat team of 10 with everyone reporting to the co-founder and CEO. In the GM role, you will help to shape our organizational and communication structures and build out the next stage of the company. Our flat structure was initially a strength but is now a limiting factor to our growth. With your help, we will grow into a "team of teams" that is better equipped for future growth.

At Tortuga, we are building a remote, humane workplace. That’s how we think work should work. As the General Manager, you will influence that vision while helping your teammates do great work.

Tortuga is comprised of Players and Coaches. Individual contributors (ICs) are Players and “managers” are Coaches. This analogy would make you the Head Coach. Longer-term, as we develop teams within the company, you will become a Coach of Coaches.

A Coach’s role is to support Players, not to tell them what to do. You are not responsible for solving every problem. You are responsible for helping Players solve their own problems and for removing roadblocks so that Players can do their jobs well. You will enable Players to spend their time in deep work, not in meetings and administrative hell.

Tortuga is and will remain a Player-first company with a low Coach-to-Player ratio.

Your experience should include growing a company or line of business from 7 to 8 figures in revenue and having managed a team of 10+ people (not necessarily all direct reports).

The GM will work directly with Fred Perrotta, the co-founder and CEO of Tortuga.

===

Tortuga is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and encourage anyone who is interested in joining our team to apply for open roles, even if you aren't certain that you're qualified. For example, research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles if they don’t meet 100% of the qualifications.

Our top priority is hiring the right person for each role at Tortuga. So we want to hear from you.

===

MISSION
To lead Tortuga as the Head Coach. You will work closely with each team member and alongside Fred, the co-founder and CEO, to execute on our strategy. You will make the team greater than the sum of its parts.

OBJECTIVES
  • Grow Tortuga from 7 to 8 figures in sales while remaining bootstrapped
  • Meet or exceed forecasted sales while staying under budget
  • Build the next iteration (V4) of the company as we transition from a flat, siloed structure to a more scalable "team of teams"

STRENGTHS
  • Coaching: You empower others to be great at their roles. You are a Coach, not a manager. Coaches don’t solve problems; they help Players solve problems. Tortuga is a Player-first company.
  • The Right Ambition: The right ambition is ambition for the company, not for yourself. If Tortuga does well, you will do well. The opposite is not necessarily true. You should be able to work towards a common, company-wide goal even when you disagree with the strategy. Doing what is best for Tortuga and our customers is more important than getting your way.
  • Taking Initiative: Every company says that it wants to hire self-starters. Remote companies have no choice. You must take initiative and hold yourself accountable to a high standard of work. No one is looking over your shoulder or tracking every minute of your work. You will likely have more autonomy at Tortuga than at your previous jobs. If you can’t turn this freedom into results, you won’t be successful on a remote team.
  • Written Communication: Everyone on a remote team must be a strong writer. We have video calls and team retreats but communicate far more often in writing (Docs, Asana, email, Slack). You must be able to communicate clearly and concisely in writing.

DO NOT APPLY IF...
  • You aren’t excited about travel. Our team is passionate about the problems we work on every day and our mission of making travel easier and more enjoyable.
  • You want to spend your day in deep work. Coaches will have a manager's schedule, not a maker’s schedule.
  • You need the structure of working at a big company. We are a small, remote team. There is no HR department. If you need something done, you do it.
  • You need the credit. We’ve built a humble, “no ego” team and only intend to hire people who fit that mold.

REQUIREMENTS
You must be based in a North America-friendly time zone as nine tenths of our team is based in the US and Canada.

BENEFITS
  • Salary: Base pay is $140,000. At Tortuga, salaries are calculated by a formula, not by negotiation. The formula includes base pay with multipliers for job level and tenure (at Tortuga).
  • Work from Anywhere: Tortuga is 100% distributed. Decide where you work best, whether that's from home, a coffee shop, a co-working space, or another country. We will even pay for your coworking membership.
  • Team Retreats: Twice per year, we meet up to plan the future and to enjoy time together in person. Past retreats include Prague, New Orleans, Lisbon, and Montreal.
  • Unlimited Vacation: You decide how much of a break you need and when. Just promise to tell us about your trip when you get back.
  • Total Coverage: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance. We pay 100% of your premiums and 50% of your dependents' premiums.
  • Retirement Savings: Tortuga matches 100% of your contributions up to 4% of your salary.
  • Parental Leave: Take up to 12 weeks of paid parental leave.
  • Free Gear: All the bags and accessories you need for your future travels.

items.content:
HEAD OF COMMERCIAL WORKING ALONGSIDE FOUNDERS TO CONTINUE OUR RAPID EXPANSION; MANAGE TEAM AND P&L WITH HUGE OPPORTUNITY TO GROW WITH THE BUSINESS.


 


ABOUT MOVEMEON


We’re a fast-growing, tech-enabled scale-up disrupting the world of recruitment. We were founded with the simple aim to make discovering great jobs easier.


Today Movemeon is used by over 37,000+ ex-consultant professionals and ~3,000 businesses. 125 professionals become members every week. We onboard ~2 new businesses every day to start hiring through us – for permanent and freelance jobs. We’re an international business and candidates have landed jobs in 100+ countries.


We’re looking for a Head of Commercial to join our team and play a critical role in our future growth.


 


THE TEAM


We’re a growing team of 20 who come from a variety of backgrounds – between us we have nine different nationalities! The founders – Nick and Rich – are both former McKinsey strategy consultants; others in the team have a mixture of prior start-up, consulting and corporate experience. University backgrounds include Oxford, Cambridge, Bocconi and others.


We’re a very open and close-knit team – we know how important it is that you enjoy working with your colleagues. As such, we prioritise getting to know each other outside of work with monthly team events and two international away trips every year. Over the past three years, we’ve travelled together to Barcelona, Seville, Brittany, Montenegro and Granada.


 


 


 


HEAD OF COMMERCIAL


The Head of Commercial reports into our two founders and co-CEOs and is responsible for leading our Growth and Success teams. This is a pivotal role for the business with a huge potential impact.


As Head of Commercial, you manage both the growth and success functions and the P&Ls of Freelance, France and Germany. You are responsible for driving improvements and strategic/ operational projects across all these teams.


The growth team is responsible for onboarding new businesses and increase loyalty with current clients, and is currently made up of 3 people. The success team, comprised of 4 people, is responsible for working with clients once they have posted – ensuring clients to get the most from the platform, and candidates hear back promptly.


 


THE KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE HEAD OF COMMERCIAL ARE



  • Owning the overall commercial performance of the UK business, overseeing the day-to-day delivery

  • Managing key commercial and operational projects across the business (in functions and across P&Ls)

  • Keeping an eye on the numbers to identify high impact actions for the team, and helping the team to deliver against these; answering questions as they arise and supporting commercial decisions

  • Day-to-day management of the success team: bringing energy and understanding the detail using data and insight

  • Driving the Personal Development of your team, ensuring they’re growing and finding opportunities to develop

  • Providing a fortnightly commercial update to co-CEOs and helping to implement strategic/ operational changes


 


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR


We’re looking for someone with likely 4-8 years’ experience and is now looking for their next challenge.


Specifically, we’re looking for:



  • Inspirational team leader: someone who inspires others to do their best

  • A people’s person: someone who really cares about their team, wants to develop them, and who wants to be part of a close and open team

  • Detail-focused and organised: someone who likes being in the detail to understand how things work, and more typically why something isn’t working

  • Management experience: both managing people and managing projects

  • A do-er: someone who gets a tick out of operational delivery, and seeing their impact/ not just talking theoretically

  • Consulting knowledge/ experience: an understanding of the market will be really helpful in working with, and supporting the team in working with, senior PE, consulting and corporate clients

  • Experience of life in a start-up and business development experience will be helpful but not a prerequisite


 


ABOUT OUR OFFER


An opportunity to have a huge impact on a fast-growth business, whilst growing and developing a close-knit and open team.


Our offer includes:



  • Exciting business in a time of rapid growth

  • Start-up environment and ethos (i.e. we don’t do face time and we don’t do anything that doesn’t need to be done)

  • Respect for and encouragement of your own ideas and initiatives

  • Real responsibility

  • Fun, smart team

  • A sensible work-life balance (we leave the office by 6 pm every day and don’t work weekends)

  • Monthly team fun & annual away weeks (http://insight.movemeon.com/hiring-retaining/building-a-team/benefits-company-away-weeks)

  • An office in central SW London (we’re based near Vauxhall tube)

  • 25 days holiday + 2 extra days at Christmas
